etymology.description: Pictogram (象形): an altar; extra strokes added to avoid confusion with ancient 下 and 主; unrelated to 小 and 京; see also 帝.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted an altar used for offerings, matching meanings tied to ritual, signs, and showing. Later graphic tweaks distinguished it from similar ancient graphs while preserving the altar-based sense of revelation and display.

examples.english: He asked the leader for instructions on the next step.
